property.name: description
property.value: (Optional) Your subID as associated with this FIX session

property.name: description
property.value: (Optional) Your locationID as associated with this FIX session

property.name: description
property.value: (Optional) counterparty's subID as associated with this FIX session

property.name: description
property.value: (Optional) counterparty's locationID as associated with this FIX session

property.name: description
property.value: Additional qualifier to disambiguate otherwise identical sessions. This can only be used with initiator sessions.Note: See Special notes for Oracle.

property.name: description
property.value: Required only for FIXT 1.1 (and newer). Ignored for earlier transport versions. Specifies the default application version ID for the session. This can either be the ApplVerID enum (see the ApplVerID field) the beginString for the default version.

property.name: description
property.value: Determines if milliseconds should be added to timestamps. Only available for FIX.4.2 and greater.

property.name: description
property.value: Use actual end of sequence gap for resend requests rather than using ''infinity'' as the end sequence of the gap. Not recommended by the FIX specification, but needed for some counterparties.

property.name: description
property.value: Tell session whether or not to expect a data dictionary. You should always use a DataDictionary if you are using repeating groups.

property.name: description
property.value: XML definition file for validating incoming FIX messages. If no DataDictionary is supplied, only basic message validation will be done. This setting should only be used with FIX transport versions old than FIXT 1.1. See TransportDataDictionary and ApplicationDataDictionary for FIXT 1.1 settings.

property.name: description
property.value: XML definition file for validating admin (transport) messages. This setting is only valid for the FIXT 1.1 (or newer) sessions. See DataDictionary for older transport versions (FIX 4.0-4.4) and for additional information.

property.name: description
property.value: XML definition file for validating application messages. This setting is only valid for the FIXT 1.1 (or newer) sessions. See DataDictionary for older transport versions (FIX 4.0-4.4) and for additional information. This setting supports the possibility of a custom application data dictionary for each session. This setting would only be used with FIXT 1.1 and new transport protocols. This setting can be used as a prefix to specify multiple application dictionaries for the FIXT transport. For example: DefaultApplVerID=FIX.4.2 # For default application version ID AppDataDictionary=FIX42.xml # For nondefault application version ID # Use beginString suffix for app version AppDataDictionary.FIX.4.4=FIX44.xml This would use FIX42.xml for the default application version ID and FIX44.xml for any FIX 4.4 messages.

property.name: description
property.value: If set to N, fields that are out of order (i.e. body fields in the header, or header fields in the body) will not be rejected. Useful for connecting to systems which do not properly order fields.

property.name: description
property.value: If set to N, fields without values (empty) will not be rejected. Useful for connecting to systems which improperly send empty tags.

property.name: description
property.value: If set to N, user defined fields will not be rejected if they are not defined in the data dictionary, or are present in messages they do not belong to.

property.name: description
property.value: Session validation setting for enabling whether field ordering is * validated. Values are ''Y'' or ''N''. Default is ''Y''.

property.name: description
property.value: Allow to bypass the message validation (against the dictionary). Default is ''Y''.

property.name: description
property.value: Check the next expected target SeqNum against the received SeqNum. Default is ''Y''. If enabled and a mismatch is detected, apply the following logic:if lower than expected SeqNum , logout if higher, send a resend request If not enabled and a mismatch is detected, nothing is done. Must be enabled for EnableNextExpectedMsgSeqNum to work.

property.name: description
property.value: Allow unknown fields in messages. This is intended for unknown fields with tags lt 5000 (not user defined fields). Use ValidateUserDefinedFields for controlling validation of tags ge 5000.

property.name: description
property.value: If set to Y, messages must be received from the counterparty with the correct SenderCompID and TargetCompID. Some systems will send you different CompIDs by design, so you must set this to N.

property.name: description
property.value: If set to Y, messages must be received from the counterparty within a defined number of seconds (see MaxLatency). It is useful to turn this off if a system uses localtime for its timestamps instead of GMT.

property.name: description
property.value: If CheckLatency is set to Y, this defines the number of seconds latency allowed for a message to be processed.

property.name: description
property.value: If RejectInvalidMessage is set to N, only a warning will be logged on reception of message that fails data dictionary validation.

property.name: description
property.value: If this configuration is enabled, an uncaught Exception or Error in the application's message processing will lead to a (BusinessMessage)Reject being sent to the counterparty and the incoming message sequence number will be incremented. If disabled (default), the problematic incoming message is discarded and the message sequence number is not incremented. Processing of the next valid message will cause detection of a sequence gap and a ResendRequest will be generated.

property.name: description
property.value: If RequiresOrigSendingTime is set to N, PossDup messages lacking that field will not be rejected.

property.name: description
property.value: Time between reconnection attempts in seconds. Only used for initiators

property.name: description
property.value: Heartbeat interval in seconds. Only used for initiators.

property.name: description
property.value: Number of seconds to wait for a logon response before disconnecting.

property.name: description
property.value: Number of seconds to wait for a logout response before disconnecting.

property.name: description
property.value: Specifies the initiator communication protocol. The SocketConnectHost is not used with the VM_PIPE protocol, but the SocketConnectPort is significant and must match the acceptor configuration.

property.name: description
property.value: Bind the local socket to this port. Only used with a SocketInitiator. If unset the socket will be bound to a free port from the ephemeral port range.

property.name: description
property.value: Bind the local socket to this host. Only used with a SocketAcceptor. If unset the socket will be bound to all local interfaces.

property.name: description
property.value: Specifies the acceptor communication protocol. The SocketAcceptAddress is not used with the VM_PIPE protocol, but the SocketAcceptPort is significant and must match the initiator configuration.

property.name: description
property.value: Refresh the session state when a logon is received. This allows a simple form of failover when the message store data is persistent. The option will be ignored for message stores that are not persistent (e.g., MemoryStore).

property.name: advice
property.value: Enter 'Y' or 'N'

property.name: description
property.value: Enables SSL usage for QFJ acceptor or initiator.

property.name: description
property.value: KeyStore to use with SSL

property.name: description
property.value: KeyStore password

property.name: description
property.value: When the keepalive option is set for a TCP socket and no data has been exchanged across the socket in either direction for 2 hours (NOTE: the actual value is implementation dependent), TCP automatically sends a keepalive probe to the peer. This probe is a TCP segment to which the peer must respond. One of three responses is expected: The peer responds with the expected ACK. The application is not notified (since everything is OK). TCP will send another probe following another 2 hours of inactivity. The peer responds with an RST, which tells the local TCP that the peer host has crashed and rebooted. The socket is closed. There is no response from the peer. The socket is closed. The purpose of this option is to detect if the peer host crashes.

property.name: description
property.value: When the OOBINLINE option is set, any TCP urgent data received on the socket will be received through the socket input stream. When the option is disabled (which is the default) urgent data is silently discarded.

property.name: description
property.value: Set a hint the size of the underlying buffers used by the platform for incoming network I/O. When used in set, this is a suggestion to the kernel from the application about the size of buffers to use for the data to be received over the socket.

property.name: description
property.value: Sets SO_REUSEADDR for a socket. This is used only for MulticastSockets in java, and it is set by default for MulticastSockets.

property.name: description
property.value: Set a hint the size of the underlying buffers used by the platform for outgoing network I/O. When used in set, this is a suggestion to the kernel from the application about the size of buffers to use for the data to be sent over the socket.

property.name: description
property.value: Specify a linger-on-close timeout. This option disables/enables immediate return from a close() of a TCP Socket. Enabling this option with a non-zero Integer timeout means that a close() will block pending the transmission and acknowledgement of all data written to the peer, at which point the socket is closed gracefully. Upon reaching the linger timeout, the socket is closed forcefully, with a TCP RST. Enabling the option with a timeout of zero does a forceful close immediately. If the specified timeout value exceeds 65,535 it will be reduced to 65,535.

property.name: description
property.value: Disable Nagle's algorithm for this connection. Written data to the network is not buffered pending acknowledgement of previously written data.

property.name: description
property.value: Sets traffic class or type-of-service octet in the IP header for packets sent from this Socket. As the underlying network implementation may ignore this value applications should consider it a hint. The tc must be in the range 0 = tc = 255 or an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. Notes: for Internet Protocol v4 the value consists of an octet with precedence and TOS fields as detailed in RFC 1349. The TOS field is bitset created by bitwise-or'ing values such the following :- IPTOS_LOWCOST (0x02) IPTOS_RELIABILITY (0x04) IPTOS_THROUGHPUT (0x08) IPTOS_LOWDELAY (0x10) The last low order bit is always ignored as this corresponds to the MBZ (must be zero) bit. Setting bits in the precedence field may result in a SocketException indicating that the operation is not permitted.

property.name: description
property.value: Write messages synchronously. This is not generally recommended as it may result in performance degradation. The MINA communication layer is asynchronous by design, but this option will override that behavior if needed.

property.name: description
property.value: The time in milliseconds to wait for a write to complete.

property.name: description
property.value: If set to N, no messages will be persisted. This will force QFJ to always send GapFills instead of resending messages. Use this if you know you never want to resend a message. Useful for market data streams.

property.name: description
property.value: Controls whether milliseconds are included in log time stamps.

property.name: description
property.value: Controls whether time stamps are included on message log entries.

property.name: description
property.value: Log category for logged events.

property.name: description
property.value: Log category for incoming messages.

property.name: description
property.value: Log category for outgoing messages.

property.name: description
property.value: Controls whether session ID is prepended to log message.

property.name: description
property.value: Controls whether heartbeats are logged.

property.name: description
property.value: Log events to screen.

property.name: description
property.value: Log incoming messages to screen.

property.name: description
property.value: Log outgoing messages to screen.

property.name: description
property.value: Filter heartbeats from output (both incoming and outgoing)

property.name: description
property.value: Determines if sequence numbers should be reset before sending/receiving a logon request.

property.name: description
property.value: Determines if sequence numbers should be reset to 1 after a normal logout termination.

property.name: description
property.value: Determines if sequence numbers should be reset to 1 after an abnormal termination.

property.name: description
property.value: Session setting for doing an automatic reset when an error occurs. A reset means disconnect, sequence numbers reset, store cleaned and reconnect, as for a daily reset.

property.name: description
property.value: Session setting for doing an automatic disconnect when an error occurs.

property.name: description
property.value: Add tag LastMsgSeqNumProcessed in the header (optional tag 369).

property.name: description
property.value: Add tag NextExpectedMsgSeqNum (optional tag 789) on the sent Logon message and use value of tag 789 on received Logon message to synchronize session. This should not be enabled for FIX versions lt 4.4. Only works when ValidateSequenceNumbers is enabled.

property.name: description
property.value: Setting to limit the size of a resend request in case of missing messages. This is useful when the remote FIX engine does not allow to ask for more than n message for a ResendRequest. E.g. if the ResendRequestChunkSize is set to 5 and a gap of 7 messages is detected, a first resend request will be sent for 5 messages. When this gap has been filled, another resend request for 2 messages will be sent. If the ResendRequestChunkSize is set to 0, only one ResendRequest for all the missing messages will be sent.

property.name: description
property.value: Continue initializing sessions if an error occurs.

property.name: description
property.value: Allows sending of redundant resend requests.

property.name: description
property.value: Fraction of the heartbeat interval which defines the additional time to wait if a TestRequest sent after a missing heartbeat times out.

property.name: description
property.value: Heartbeat detection is disabled. A disconnect due to a missing heartbeat will never occur.

property.name: description
property.value: Fill in heartbeats on resend when reading from message store fails.

property.name: description
property.value: Name of the session modifiers to apply to this session
